intro: Peritoma breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered peritoma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or red in color. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Peritoma breviflora is adapted to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
